meanings.definition: Act dishonestly or unfairly in order to gain an advantage.
meanings.sent1: She was caught cheating on the test by looking at her neighbor's paper.
meanings.sent2: He cheated by using a cheat sheet during the exam.
meanings.sent3: The student tried cheating by sneaking a peek at the answers.
meanings.sent4: Cheating in the game is like trying to win without playing fair.
meanings.sent5: The athlete was disqualified for cheating during the race.

meanings.definition: Deceive or trick someone for personal gain.
meanings.sent1: He was cheating his friend by pretending to agree with him.
meanings.sent2: She cheated her way into getting a promotion at work.
meanings.sent3: The magician was cheating the audience with his clever tricks.
meanings.sent4: Cheating others for personal gain will only lead to trouble.
meanings.sent5: The scammer was caught cheating people out of their money.

meanings.definition: Engage in deceitful behavior in a relationship or game.
meanings.sent1: They accused him of cheating in the relationship by talking to someone else.
meanings.sent2: She cheated in the game by pretending to follow the rules.
meanings.sent3: The player was caught cheating by hiding extra cards up his sleeve.
meanings.sent4: Cheating in a relationship is like breaking the trust between two people.
meanings.sent5: The team lost the match due to their opponent cheating during the game.
